title: Blue Economy for Revitalization of Oceans - Modern Diplomacy
summary: The Blue Economy promotes sustainable use of oceans for improved livelihood and economic growth without compromising the ocean health. The Blue Economy encompasses sustainable fisheries, aquaculture, marine renewable energy, marine biotechnology, and responsible tourism. Investing in the Blue Economy has the potential to resolve global issues associated with economic growth and climate change by creating new industries, jobs, and economic opportunities.

green_product: TRUE, The Blue Economy promotes the development and use of green products, such as sustainably caught seafood, bio-based products, and renewable energy technologies.

title: Gulu in bid to end plastic menace - Monitor
summary: Gulu City in Uganda has implemented several projects to reduce plastic pollution, including awareness campaigns, plastic waste banks, and partnerships with local recycling firms. The city is collaborating on a waste collection app to enhance data collection and improve waste management efficiency. School clubs are being established to promote environmental conservation and recycling among young people.

green_process: TRUE, the article describes the implementation of plastic waste banks, which facilitate the collection and recycling of plastic waste, reducing environmental pollution.

title: Hindustan Unilever: Empowering Consumers For 90 Years - Inventiva
summary: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) is a leading Indian consumer goods company with a diverse product portfolio and a strong commitment to innovation, quality, and sustainability.
